description: This file defines an abstract class 'Task' that implements Runnable, providing a framework for executing and controlling long-running tasks in separate threads. It includes thread management, cancellation, auto-restart capabilities, and lifecycle hooks for subclasses.

classes.name: Task
classes.description: An abstract class for creating cancellable, restartable long-running tasks with hooks for subclass-specific behavior.

methods.name: isRunning
methods.description: Returns whether the task is currently executing.

methods.name: isCanceled
methods.description: Returns whether the task has been signaled to cancel.

methods.name: start
methods.description: Starts the task in a new thread if not already running.

methods.name: cancel
methods.description: Signals the task to cancel and optionally waits for it to stop.

methods.name: shouldAutoRestart
methods.description: Checks if the task should automatically restart after completion.

methods.name: setAutoRestart
methods.description: Sets whether the task should automatically restart upon termination.

methods.name: run
methods.description: Main execution method for the task, managing lifecycle and calling subclass hooks.

methods.name: keepLooping
methods.description: Determines whether the task should continue execution.

methods.name: onStart
methods.description: Hook for subclass initialization before task execution loop.

methods.name: onRestart
methods.description: Hook called before the thread auto-restarts.

methods.name: onStop
methods.description: Hook called after the task loop ends.

methods.name: onCancel
methods.description: Hook called during cancellation before the thread exits.

methods.name: execute
methods.description: Abstract method to be implemented by subclasses to perform task actions.
